definition: room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: Check with your parents before going into a chat room.
sentences.chinese: 進入聊天室之前，先經得家長的同意。

sentences.english: Carry on the real-time discussion through the coatroom and teacher.
sentences.chinese: 通過聊天室與老師進行實時討論。

sentences.english: Multi-threaded applications written Internet chat room program.
sentences.chinese: 應用多線程編寫網絡聊天室程序。

sentences.english: Identity doesn't relly matter when you're in a chat room discussing politics or hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 當你在聊天室講座政治或嗜好時，身份並不那麼重要。

sentences.english: Don't go into questionable chat rooms.
sentences.chinese: 不要進那些有問題的聊天室。

sentences.english: Internet chat rooms are packed with frustrated CFA candidates.
sentences.chinese: CFA考生在互聯網聊天室裏怨聲載道。

sentences.english: Check out this chat set up specifically for discussion of the Iran election and aftermath.
sentences.chinese: 點擊這裏查看專爲伊朗大選及其餘波而準備的聊天室。

sentences.english: He made absurd statements in the internet chat room.
sentences.chinese: 他在網路聊天室裏大放闕辭。

sentences.english: Bosworth said that the service was modeled after chat.
sentences.chinese: 博斯沃斯表示這項服務是仿照聊天室。

sentences.english: These chat rooms take up a lot of my time.
sentences.chinese: 這些聊天室佔去了我大量時間。

sentences.english: The session consists of therapist and client emailing back and forth in a chat room.
sentences.chinese: 在聊天室，專家和病人通過電子郵件夾來回談論。

sentences.english: After several hours in "whisper" mode, we opted to enter my personal chat room.
sentences.chinese: “私聊”了幾小時，我們轉入我開的私人聊天室。

sentences.english: This enables long-lived client connections such as those in chat room applications.
sentences.chinese: 這能允許聊天室之類的應用有長客戶端連接。

sentences.english: The community doesn’t stop in forums and chat rooms, though.
sentences.chinese: 社區並不僅僅以論壇和聊天室的形式存在。

sentences.english: Online, at least you can get a feel for how well they spell.
sentences.chinese: 而在網絡聊天室，至少還可以看看他的拼寫能力咋樣。

definition: (of two people in different locations) to sing or otherwise perform together using communications technology
VoIP (Voice over IP) (computing)/to speak with others over the Internet
Momo, GPS-based app for messaging, and potentially meeting up with, other Momo users (typically, strangers) in one's vicinity, launched in 2011
online game/abbr. for 網絡遊戲|网络游戏
